content: On September 24, 1998, the Atlanta Braves secured their seventh consecutive National League East title with a 7-1 victory over the New York Mets at Turner Field. This win marked a significant milestone in the team's history as they clinched the division and continued their dominance in the late 1990s, led by stars like Greg Maddux and Chipper Jones. The Braves would go on to make a deep playoff run that year, further solidifying their status as a powerhouse in Major League Baseball.
